tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: who does not walk in the advice of the wicked
tn.text: The "advice of the wicked" is spoken of as if it were a path to follow. AT: "who does not follow the advice of the wicked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: stand in the pathway with sinners
tn.text: Here the word "pathway" represents the way people live. The word "stand" is in parallel with "walk." AT: "imitate the behavior of sinful people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: or sit in the assembly of mockers
tn.text: Sitting with people who mock God represents joining the people who mock God. AT: "or join those who mock God" or "or mock God with others who mock him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: delight
tn.text: "contentment" or "joy"

tn.ref: Yahweh
tn.text: This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: This passage introduces an elaborate image in which a righteous person is thought of in terms of a flourishing tree.

tn.ref: He will be like a tree ... fruit in its season
tn.text: In the Bible, people are often spoken of as trees. People who delight in Yahweh's law can do all God wants them to do just as a tree that is planted by water produces good fruit. AT: "He will be prosperous like a tree ... fruit in its season" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: planted by the streams of water
tn.text: A tree that is planted by a stream can get enough water to be healthy.

tn.ref: that produces its fruit in its season
tn.text: Healthy trees produce good fruit at the right time.

tn.ref: whose leaves do not wither
tn.text: If a tree gets enough water, its leaves do not dry out and die.

tn.ref: whatever he does will prosper
tn.text: "He will be successful at whatever he does"

tn.ref: The wicked are not so
tn.text: How they are not like that can be stated clearly. "The wicked are not prosperous" or "The wicked do  not prosper" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: but are instead like the chaff
tn.text: How they are like chaff can be stated clearly. AT: "but instead they are worthless like the chaff" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: will not stand in the judgment
tn.text: Surviving when God judges is spoken of as "standing." AT: "will not survive when God judges them" or "will be condemned when God judges them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]

tn.ref: nor sinners in the assembly
tn.text: Translators can supply the verb "stand." AT: "neither will sinners stand in the assembly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous
tn.text: Being accepted by God as righteous is spoken of as standing with the group of righteous people.  AT: "and God will not accept sinners along with the righteous people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: For Yahweh approves of the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked will perish
tn.text: These two clauses contrast what happens to righteous people with what happens to wicked people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: the way of the righteous
tn.text: How people live is spoken of as if it were a "way" or "road" that they are walking on. AT: "how the righteous live (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the way of the wicked will perish
tn.text: Here "way" stands for the wicked, who are figuratively walking on the way. AT: "The wicked will perish because of their way" or "the wicked will die because of the way they live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
